intro: Hieracium laevigatum subsp. tridentatum, commonly known as the three-toothed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are hairy and have a distinctive three-lobed shape, while its yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster. This subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
